alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Union; Wayne (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WAYNE, NORTHERN UNION AND FAYETTE COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA, NORTHERN PREBLE, DARKE AND SOUTHEASTERN MERCER COUNTIES IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 159 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Winchester, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Connersville, Greenville, Eaton, Centerville, Cambridge City, Versailles, Liberty, Arcanum, Lewisburg, Hagerstown, Union City, New Paris, Ansonia, New Madison, Fountain City, Dublin, Glenwood, Franklin and Waterloo. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Indiana between mile markers 134 and 156. I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for east central Indiana...and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
